intro: Urera pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive reddish or purplish hue. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, facilitating wind dispersal.
